means: （使）服水土，（使）适应新气候或环境

sentence.Network_en: Arrive two days early in order to acclimatize.
sentence.Network_cn: 提前两天到达以便适应新环境。

sentence.Network_en: It takes him several months to acclimatize to working at night.
sentence.Network_cn: 他需要几个月才能习惯于夜间工作.

sentence.Network_en: By this reckoning, a flexible body learns to acclimatize to stresses.
sentence.Network_cn: 由此可以判断, 灵活可塑的身体学会适应压力.

entry.tran: （使）适应；（使）服水土；（使）习惯于（新情况、新地方或新气候）
entry.def: When you acclimatize or are acclimatized to a new situation, place, or climate, you become used to it.

example.ex: The athletes are acclimatising to the heat by staying in Monte Carlo...
example.tran: 运动员通过留驻蒙特卡洛来适应酷热。

example.ex: This year he has left for St Louis early to acclimatise himself...
example.tran: 今年他早早地前往圣路易斯以便适应新环境。

means.word_mean: 1. get used to a certain climate;
(使)服水土,(使)适应新气候或环境

sentences.en: They are not acclimatized to the tropics.
sentences.cn: 他们还不适应热带气候。

sentences.en: I believe they will quickly acclimatize.
sentences.cn: 我相信他们很快就会适应的。
